node.title: Review: This Revival of Sondheim’s ‘Assassins’ Misses Its Mark
node.description: The production lacks the power to unsettle despite a fine cast of killers and wannabes who changed, or at least made, history gunning for presidents.

node.title: Dozens of N.Y.C. sanitation workers were suspended during an inquiry into the use of fake vaccine cards.
node.description: It is the latest chapter in the protracted debate over the city’s vaccine mandate for municipal workers.

node.title: Queensland brings forward softening of border rules with passes available from this afternoon
node.description: The Queensland government brings forward the opening of the state's border to some fully vaccinated travellers from interstate COVID-19 hotspots, with people able to apply for their border passes from 5:00pm today.

node.title: William Tyrrell search renewed by police, seven years after his disappearance
node.description: A new search is planned for William Tyrrell, missing from his foster-grandmother's home since 2014, police announce.

node.title: It has taken 52 years, but bank heist mystery finally solved
node.description: US authorities have solved a bank heist mystery that stumped investigators for more than five decades.

node.title: Focus on Politics: Family Court frustrations stoke calls for change
node.description: Podcast - As the Family Court nears its 40th anniversary, lawyers' say the system falls short of its own standards and Māori leaders say their calls for change have not been heard. Anneke Smith report… Audio

node.title: Government to address 'quirk' in new one-off residence visa
node.description: The government says it will look at a 'quirk' in immigration policy that means some workers have to leave the country and fly back in to be eligible for next year's one-off residence visa.

node.title: Project to fix Carillon tower extended by five years
node.description: A 50m-tall tower with 70 tonnes of bells in it that presents a high earthquake risk in central Wellington has been approved to stay that way for up to six years.

node.title: Warnings over finance course spreading in Māori, Pasifika community
node.description: A Hamilton woman living in the US admits she targets single mothers, Māori and Pasifika to join a finance course that international regulators have likened to a pyramid scam.

node.title: Climate Promises Made in Glasgow Now Rest With a Handful of Powerful Leaders
node.description: In Washington, Beijing, New Delhi and beyond, governments face conflicting forces — political, social and economic — that will shape their next steps in the effort to avert a climate crisis.

node.title: Steve Bannon Indictment Already Compelling Witnesses to Answer Subpoenas: Adam Schiff
node.description: "I view this as an early test of whether democracy was recovering," Schiff said Sunday.

node.title: 'Convoluted Messaging' on Booster Shots Draws Criticism: 'The Data Is Incredibly Clear'
node.description: "The confusing message around the boosters may end up being one of the biggest missed opportunities in this pandemic," Scott Gottlieb said Sunday.

node.title: SA authorities announce extra details for state border reopening
node.description: South Australian authorities provide further details around the state's border reopening plan, due to come into effect on November 23.

node.title: Parekōwhai work sets NZ art auction record
node.description: 'A Peak in Darien' sold for a record $2.05 million and two McCahon works fetched in excess of $1m each at Art + Object's weekend auction.

node.title: 'A workman-like job' - Mixed reaction to COP26 in New Zealand
node.description: The outcome of the COP26 climate summit won't help anyone sleep at night with the world still on track for catastrophic warming, but New Zealand observers say there has been some good out of it.

node.title: Austria orders lockdown for unvaccinated residents
node.description: The move prohibits unvaccinated people 12 and older from leaving their homes except for basic activities such as working, grocery shopping, going for a walk — or getting vaccinated.

node.title: Irene is one of Australia's most in-demand workers right now. Here's why
node.description: As a registered nurse, Irene McInerney's skill set is one of the most sought after in the nation. But like millions of other workers, she's feeling the strain of the labour shortage, which has left experts reeling.

node.title: Tesla boss praises New Zealand's EV efforts
node.description: The head of the world's leading electric vehicle maker has heaped praise on New Zealand for its efforts to electrify the country's vehicle fleet and cut emissions.

node.title: COP26: How might decisions at the climate summit change our lives?
node.description: A deal has been made at the climate summit in Glasgow, but what will that mean for the average person?

node.title: Jamie Wall: All Blacks drown in the Green Room
node.description: Ireland have beaten the All Blacks for the third time in five years. Jamie Wall  writes it's not so much that New Zealand played particularly badly, it's that they were barely allowed to play at all.

node.title: Lee Maracle, Combative Indigenous Author, Dies at 71
node.description: She collected signatures to persuade publishers that people would buy her books. She became a foundational figure in Indigenous literature.

node.title: Cost of Turkey Forces Town to Cancel 70-Year Tradition as Inflation Soars
node.description: "It's terrible," said one resident. "But I am not surprised. Everything is going sky high. And it doesn't look like things are going to get better."

node.title: The rare frog that swallows its babies is now extinct —  but could cloning bring it back?
node.description: The Eungella gastric-brooding frog is now believed extinct —  but in a real-life Jurassic Park scenario, some scientists are working to undo that.

node.title: Boris Johnson says climate deal is 'death knell' for coal
node.description: Boris Johnson says agreements from most countries to stop funding overseas fossil fuel projects are a major advance in the fight against climate change.

node.title: Mum's lifelong struggles suddenly made sense when son received diagnosis
node.description: Helen Whitaker was 39 when her son's diagnosis of ADHD led to her own transformational medical discovery.

node.title: Hobart shivers through likely coldest November night in over 60 years, wakes to snow
node.description: It was meant to be late spring, but temperatures in Hobart dropped to 2.9 degrees last night and many people woke to snow falling in their backyards.

node.title: David Warner has been more brilliant than controversial
node.description: Far from a cricketing choirboy, David Warner's influence in the sport has once again been shown to be more than just controversy and he's once and for all etched his name into the sport's folklore, writes Paul Johnson.

node.title: Victoria records 860 new COVID-19 cases and five deaths
node.description: There are now 17,518 active cases of the virus in Victoria, and 416 people have died in the state during the current Delta outbreak.

node.title: Italian Coast Guard rescues 550 migrants from stormy seas
node.description: Authorities say an increasing number of human traffickers are using a route along the southern tip of the Italian peninsula.

node.title: Fourth Stimulus Check Update: Petition for Monthly $2K Stalls in Home Stretch to 3M Signatures
node.description: The petition has drawn more than 2,956,600 signatures, with only about 5,000 new supporters in the past week.

node.title: Biden Has Higher Approval than Trump at Same Point in WH Tenure Despite Rapid Drop
node.description: The president's approval rating remains an average of more than 4 points higher than his Republican predecessor.

node.title: 1/6 Subpoena Defiers Aim to 'Wait It Out' Until Midterms: Former Trump Admin Aide
node.description: Olivia Troye, a former aide to Mike Pence, accused Trump administration officials of "undermining the rule of law."

node.title: Your Monday Briefing
node.description: A global climate agreement.

node.title: COP26 climate deal 'least worst' outcome, says James Shaw
node.description: The COP26 climate summit agreement has enraged environmentalists but the consensus from delegates is that it is better than no deal at all.

node.title: Infratil makes record half year profit of $1.08b boosted by Tilt Renewables sale
node.description: The infrastructure investor Infratil has made a record half year profit of more than a $1 billion boosted by significant gain on the sale of Tilt Renewables.

node.title: Manufacturing sector continuing to expand, new data shows
node.description: Manufacturing activity is continuing to rebound as Covid-19 restrictions ease.

node.title: Auckland's outbreak could soon reach peak - Hendy
node.description: Auckland's Covid-19 outbreak is on track to reach a peak by the end of November, latest modelling suggests, but other pockets of the country are warned they might be in for a bumpy ride.

node.title: Woman with Covid-19 gave birth to a baby who later died
node.description: A Covid-19 case reported yesterday gave birth prematurely at Rotorua Hospital and their baby later died.

node.title: Austria orders unvaccinated into lockdown amid COVID-19 surge
node.description: Millions of people not fully vaccinated against COVID-19 have been ordered into lockdown, as the European nation grapples with record infection levels and growing strain on intensive care units.

node.title: Etel Adnan, Lebanese American Author and Artist, Dies at 96
node.description: Her novel about a kidnapping in Lebanon has become a classic of war literature. She was in her 80s when her art started to draw international attention.

node.title: 'This isn't good enough': Defective government-funded houses to be demolished
node.description: The Northern Territory government will demolish and rebuild a group of dilapidated and issue-plagued Palmerston houses — but residents in another eight potentially unsafe houses will continue living in them.

node.title: Three arrested under Terrorism Act after deadly UK hospital blast
node.description: UK counter-terrorism officers arrest three people after one person is killed in a vehicle explosion outside the Women's Hospital in the north-western city of Liverpool.

node.title: Karen Bass Says Ahmaud Arbery Trial Off to a 'Bad Start' Because the Jury Is Nearly All White
node.description: "The Arbery trial is a trial of a lynching. That is exactly what happened in that case," the California Democratic congresswoman said.

node.title: Trump 2024 Run Could 'Tear' Fabric of U.S. Democracy, Prominent GOP Lawyer Warns
node.description: Republican attorney Ben Ginsberg said the former president already put a "huge strain" on the U.S. political system in 2020.

node.title: Air Route to Belarus Closed to Migrants in Bid to Halt Crisis
node.description: Hoping to stem the flow of migrants stuck on the border of Belarus and Poland, Dubai banned Iraqi and Syrian passengers from traveling to Minsk.
